en: Keep an eye on the bags.
zh: 请留意这些包。

en: Please show me your bag.
zh: 请给我看看你的包。

en: Please open your bag.
zh: 请打开你的包。

en: I saw flashing red lights in my rear-view mirror and my heart sank.
zh: 我从后视镜里看到闪烁的红灯，我的心都凉了。

en: The rear-view mirror fell off.
zh: 后视镜掉了。

en: Where can I put my bag?
zh: 我能把我的包放在哪里？

en: If you can't lift your backpack, then you can't carry it!
zh: 如果你提不动你的背包，你就不能背它！

en: The candy I had in my bag went mushy in the heat.
zh: 我包里的糖在高温下融化了。

en: One of my bags is missing.
zh: 我的一个包不见了。

en: The train for Birmingham leaves from platform 3.
zh: 去伯明翰的火车从3号站台出发。

en: Not to mince matters, I don't want you to come to our party.
zh: 我不拐弯抹角了，我不想你来参加我们的聚会。

en: To put it clearly, I don't like him.
zh: 说白了，我不喜欢他。

en: Quit talking like you've got something stuck in your mouth and say what you mean.
zh: 别像嘴里含着东西似的说话，有话直说。

en: Give it to me straight.
zh: 直说吧。

en: Just for the record, I totally disagree with this decision.
zh: 郑重声明，我完全不同意这个决定。

en: Frankly speaking, he is wrong.
zh: 坦率地说，他是错的。

en: Get to the point!
zh: 说重点！

en: Speak up!
zh: 大声点！

en: There were no visible dangers.
zh: 没有明显的危险。

en: I will give you a call as soon as I know for sure.
zh: 一旦我确定了，我会立刻给你打电话。

en: There is nothing more shameful than to say what one cannot say for certain.
zh: 没有什么比说自己不能确定的事情更可耻的了。

en: I don't know for certain.
zh: 我不能确定。

en: May I ask a few more questions about that point? It's a little obscure.
zh: 关于那一点，我可以再问几个问题吗？ 有点含糊不清。

en: I am not sure, but I think I want to be a teacher.
zh: 我不确定，但我认为我想当一名老师。

en: Give me a definite answer.
zh: 给我一个明确的答复。

en: I guess I haven't made myself clear.
zh: 我想我还没表达清楚。

en: I pronounce this a perfect dinner.
zh: 我宣布这是一顿完美的晚餐。

en: Mice are distinct from rats.
zh: 老鼠和大鼠是不同的。

en: There is no sugar in the bowl.
zh: 碗里没有糖。

en: A hummingbird is no larger than a butterfly.
zh: 蜂鸟不比蝴蝶大。

en: A bee flew out of the window.
zh: 一只蜜蜂从窗户飞了出去。

en: Kick with your legs straight to go forward.
zh: 伸直腿踢才能前进。

en: Bread and butter is my usual breakfast.
zh: 面包和黄油是我通常的早餐。

en: I ate nothing but bread and butter.
zh: 我只吃了面包和黄油。

en: You've run through all the butter?
zh: 你把所有的黄油都用完了？

en: Please pass me the butter.
zh: 请把黄油递给我。

en: I'd like some more butter.
zh: 我想要更多的黄油。

en: Bread and butter is their usual breakfast.
zh: 面包和黄油是他们通常的早餐。

en: Pass me the butter, please.
zh: 请把黄油递给我。

en: Butter and cheese are made from milk.
zh: 黄油和奶酪是用牛奶制成的。

en: Butter is made from cream.
zh: 黄油是用奶油制成的。

en: Butter is made from milk.
zh: 黄油是用牛奶制成的。

en: We make butter from milk.
zh: 我们用牛奶制作黄油。

en: What is butter made of?
zh: 黄油是用什么做的？

en: Butter is sold by the pound.
zh: 黄油是按磅出售的。

en: You can use margarine as a substitute for butter.
zh: 你可以用人造黄油代替黄油。

en: Dr. Patterson communicated with a gorilla using sign language.
zh: 帕特森博士用手语与一只大猩猩交流。

en: Dr. Patterson also uses spoken language with Koko.
zh: 帕特森博士也用口语与科科交流。

en: Dr. Patterson: She made the sign for cat.
zh: 帕特森博士：她做了猫的手势。

en: Dr. Patterson: Oh, no! She was very gentle with him.
zh: 帕特森博士：哦，不！她对他很温柔。

en: Dr. Patterson: Not at all! Koko has taught us that gorillas are intelligent enough to learn sign language.
zh: 帕特森博士：一点也不！科科教会了我们，大猩猩足够聪明，可以学习手语。

en: Dr. Patterson: Yes, it was horrible.
zh: 帕特森博士：是的，那太可怕了。

en: Dr. Patterson: Sure. Do you know about Koko's love for cats?
zh: 帕特森博士：当然。你知道科科对猫的喜爱吗？

en: It is unclear in Patterson's experiment whether the output objects fully correspond to the designed models.
zh: 在帕特森的实验中，尚不清楚输出对象是否完全对应于设计的模型。

en: I broke the personal computer.
zh: 我把个人电脑弄坏了。

en: I need some butter. Do you have any?
zh: 我需要一些黄油。你有什么吗？

en: Personal computers are of great use.
zh: 个人电脑用途很大。

en: I am seeking a person who can write a personal computer manual.
zh: 我正在寻找一个会写个人电脑手册的人。

en: She alone is able to use the personal computer.
zh: 只有她会使用个人电脑。

en: How much is the bus fare?
zh: 公交车票多少钱？

en: Bus rates have stayed the same for two years.
zh: 公交车票价已经两年没变了。

en: What do you think of the idea of making a bus trip?
zh: 你觉得坐公共汽车旅行这个主意怎么样？

en: I'd like to have a single room with a bath for two nights.
zh: 我想订一个带浴室的单人间，住两晚。

en: A single room with bath, please.
zh: 请给我一个带浴室的单人间。

en: It's a ten minutes walk to the bus stop.
zh: 走到公共汽车站要十分钟。

en: Would you like a room with a bath or a shower?
zh: 您想要带浴室还是淋浴的房间？

en: Could you show me the way to the bus stop?
zh: 请问去公共汽车站怎么走？

en: Our house is quite satisfactory except that it is rather a long way to the bus stop.
zh: 我们的房子很令人满意，只是离公共汽车站有点远。

en: The bus stop is across the street.
zh: 公共汽车站就在街对面。

en: The bus stop is quite handy.
zh: 公共汽车站很方便。

en: The bus stop is near our school.
zh: 公共汽车站离我们学校很近。

en: Where's the bus stop?
zh: 公共汽车站在哪里？

en: The bus stop is close by.
zh: 公共汽车站就在附近。

en: The bus stop is five minutes' walk from here.
zh: 从这里步行到公共汽车站需要五分钟。

en: Getting to the bus stop, he found the bus had left.
zh: 当他到达公共汽车站时，发现公共汽车已经开走了。

en: The bus had already left when I got to the bus stop.
zh: 我到公交车站的时候，公交车已经开走了。

en: Show me the way to the bus stop.
zh: 请你告诉我到公交车站怎么走。

en: I'll call you back when I get to the bus stop.
zh: 我到公交车站后给你回电话。

en: There was not a long queue at the bus stop.
zh: 公交车站没有排很长的队。

en: No one is waiting at the bus stop. We may have missed the bus.
zh: 公交车站没有人等车。我们可能错过了公交车。

en: What's the bus fare?
zh: 公交车票多少钱？

en: The bus fare was raised.
zh: 公交车票价上涨了。

en: The bus fares have been raised by 20 percent.
zh: 公交车票价上涨了百分之二十。

en: Where can I catch a bus?
zh: 我在哪里可以搭公交车？

en: Please tell me where the bus stop is.
zh: 请告诉我公交车站在哪里。

en: I'd rather walk than wait for a bus.
zh: 我宁愿走路也不想等公交车。

en: The man waiting for the bus lost his temper.
zh: 等公交车的那个人发脾气了。

en: While waiting for bus, I was caught in a shower.
zh: 等公交车的时候，我淋了场雨。

en: While I was waiting for the bus, I saw a traffic accident.
zh: 我等公交车的时候，看到了一起交通事故。

en: Waiting for a bus, I met my friend.
zh: 等公交车的时候，我遇到了我的朋友。

en: Bus service must be increased in frequency.
zh: 公交车的班次应该增加。

en: It is careless of me to take the wrong bus.
zh: 我真粗心，竟然坐错了公交车。

en: We had to wait a little while for a bus.
zh: 我们不得不等一会儿才有公交车来。

en: While getting off the bus, she heard her name called.
zh: 下公交车的时候，她听见有人叫她的名字。

en: How long have you been waiting for the bus?
zh: 你等公交车多久了？

en: I took the wrong bus.
zh: 我坐错了公交车。

en: The bus passed five minutes ago.
zh: 公交车五分钟前开走了。

en: I can't finish this part of the puzzle.
zh: 我拼不完这部分拼图。

en: The bathroom is occupied now.
zh: 现在洗手间有人。

en: The bathroom is at the end of the hall.
zh: 洗手间在走廊的尽头。

en: I'd rather walk than take a bus.
zh: 我宁愿走路也不要坐公交车。

en: When riding a bus or a train, you need to pay the fare.
zh: 乘坐公共汽车或火车时，您需要支付车费。

en: Would you mind letting me see your passport?
zh: 请问您介意让我看一下您的护照吗？

en: May I see your passport, please?
zh: 请问我可以看一下您的护照吗？

en: May I see your passport?
zh: 我可以看看你的护照吗？

en: Someone stole my passport.
zh: 有人偷了我的护照。

en: What's the best way for me to get a passport?
zh: 我办理护照的最佳方式是什么？

en: I have my passport.
zh: 我有我的护照。

en: Will you show me your passport, please?
zh: 请您出示您的护照好吗？

en: Passport, please.
zh: 请出示护照。

en: May I look at your passport?
zh: 我可以看一下你的护照吗？

en: Show me your passport, please.
zh: 请给我看看你的护照。

en: The passport important on your trip.
zh: 护照在您的旅途中很重要。

en: A passport identifies you as a citizen of a country and allows you to travel to foreign countries.
zh: 护照可以证明您是一个国家的公民，并允许您前往外国旅行。

en: Do you have your passport?
zh: 你有你的护照吗？

en: A passport is something you cannot do without when you go to a foreign country.
zh: 出国旅行时，护照是必不可少的东西。

en: Do you remember your passport number?
zh: 你还记得你的护照号码吗？

en: The person whose name was on the passport was described with words.
zh: 护照上的人的名字是用文字描述的。

en: I lost my passport. I'll have to get a new one.
zh: 我丢了护照。我得办一个新的。

en: I need your passport and three pictures.
zh: 我需要你的护照和三张照片。

en: I became very nervous when I couldn't locate my passport.
zh: 当我找不到我的护照时，我变得非常紧张。

en: Without a passport, leaving a country is out of the question.
zh: 没有护照，离开一个国家是不可能的。

en: The bus was filled to capacity.
zh: 公共汽车满载。

en: The bus was heading north.
zh: 公共汽车正朝北行驶。

en: The bus was very crowded. I wish I had taken a taxi.
zh: 公共汽车非常拥挤。我真希望我当时打了一辆出租车。

en: The bus was about to start.
zh: 公交车就要开了。

en: The bus left five minutes ahead of time.
zh: 公交车提前五分钟开了。

en: The bus arrived ten minutes behind time.
zh: 公交车晚点十分钟到达。

en: The bus stopped suddenly in the middle of the street.
zh: 公交车突然停在马路中间。

en: It seemed that the bus had been late.
zh: 看来公交车已经晚点了。

en: The bus left early.
zh: 公交车提前出发了。

en: The bus stopped to take up passengers.
zh: 公交车停下来接乘客。

en: The bus rocked heavily up and down.
zh: 公交车上下剧烈摇晃。

en: The bus picked up the speed gradually.
zh: 公交车逐渐加速。

en: The buses left one after another.
zh: 公交车一辆接一辆地开走了。

en: The bus will have started before we get there.
zh: 在我们到达之前，公交车应该已经开了。

en: The bus has just left.
zh: 公交车刚刚离开。

en: The bus was late because of the traffic jam.
zh: 因为交通堵塞，公交车晚点了。

en: The bus stopped sharply.
zh: 公交车急刹车。

en: The bus leaves in five minutes.
zh: 公交车五分钟后出发。

en: The bus deposited us at the station.
zh: 公交车把我们放在了车站。

en: How often do the buses run?
zh: 公交车多久一班？

en: The bus has already gone.
zh: 公交车已经走了。

en: The bus is due here any time now.
zh: 公交车随时都会到。

en: The bus hasn't come yet.
zh: 公交车还没来。

en: The buses ran back and forth almost empty.
zh: 公交车几乎空着来回行驶。

en: The bus went past the bus stop.
zh: 公交车开过了车站。

en: The bus stopped in every village.
zh: 公交车在每个村庄都停。

en: How long ago did the bus leave?
zh: 公交车多久前开走的？

en: The bus was very crowded.
zh: 公交车非常拥挤。

en: Where will the bus pick us up?
zh: 公共汽车在哪里接我们？

en: Could you tell me where I can get a bus?
zh: 请问在哪里可以搭到公共汽车？

en: The bus rattled as it drove along the bumpy road.
zh: 公共汽车在颠簸的路上行驶，发出嘎嘎声。

en: The bus was so crowded that I was kept standing all the way to the station.
zh: 公共汽车太拥挤了，我一路站到车站。

en: The bus should be coming soon.
zh: 公共汽车应该快来了。

en: The bus will come soon.
zh: 公共汽车很快就来。

en: The bus doesn't always come on time.
zh: 公共汽车并不总是准时到达。

en: The bus was two minutes early.
zh: 公共汽车早到了两分钟。

en: There is only one bus every two hours.
zh: 每两个小时只有一班公共汽车。

en: Buses are running at 20 minute intervals.
zh: 公共汽车每隔20分钟一班。

en: There is a bus every fifteen minutes.
zh: 每隔十五分钟有一班公共汽车。

en: The bus leaves every fifteen minutes.
zh: 公共汽车每隔十五分钟发车。

en: The bus will arrive within ten minutes.
zh: 公共汽车将在十分钟内到达。

en: The buses run every ten minutes.
zh: 公共汽车每隔十分钟一班。

en: The bus leaves every ten minutes.
zh: 公共汽车每隔十分钟发车。

en: May I have a bus route map?
zh: 请给我一张公共汽车路线图。

en: What time does the bus leave?
zh: 公共汽车几点发车？

en: There ought to be a better bus service.
zh: 应该有更好的公共汽车服务。

en: I'd like a bus route map.
zh: 我想要一张公共汽车路线图。

en: Is there a bus service?
zh: 有公共汽车服务吗？

en: As there was no bus service, we had to walk all the way to the station.
zh: 因为没有公共汽车服务，我们不得不一路走到车站。

en: We had much difficulty in finding the bus stop.
zh: 我们很难找到公共汽车站。

en: Let's run to the bus stop.
zh: 我们跑去公共汽车站吧。

en: I'll race you to the bus stop.
zh: 我和你赛跑去公共汽车站。

en: Since there was no vacant seat on the bus, I stood the whole way.
zh: 因为公共汽车上没有空位，我一路站着。

en: There were no more than five passengers in the bus.
zh: 公共汽车上最多只有五个乘客。

en: I often talk to him on the bus.
zh: 我经常在公共汽车上和他说话。

en: Can I buy a ticket on the bus?
zh: 我可以在公共汽车上买票吗？

en: A stranger spoke to me in the bus.
zh: 一个陌生人在公共汽车上和我说话。

en: I came upon a friend of mine in the bus.
zh: 我在公共汽车上碰到了我的一个朋友。

en: I ran into Mr Lynch on the bus.
zh: 我在公共汽车上碰到了林奇先生。

en: The front of the bus was not crowded.
zh: 公共汽车的前面不拥挤。

en: Most of the passengers on the bus were sleeping.
zh: 公共汽车上的大多数乘客都在睡觉。

en: The bus conductor told her to get off because she could not pay the fare.
zh: 售票员让她下车，因为她付不起车费。

en: May I have a bus schedule?
zh: 我可以要一份公交时刻表吗？

en: A bus driver is responsible for the safety of the passengers.
zh: 公交车司机对乘客的安全负责。

en: The driver told us to be careful when we got off the bus.
zh: 司机告诉我们下车时要小心。

en: The bus drivers are on strike today.
zh: 今天的公交车司机在罢工。

en: The bus service won't be available until the snow has melted.
zh: 公交服务要等到雪融化后才能恢复。

en: I was late for the bus, late for work, and got a run my stockings.
zh: 我错过了公共汽车，上班迟到了，而且把丝袜也刮破了。

en: You must buy a ticket to get on the bus.
zh: 你必须买票才能上车。

en: It was careless of you to miss the bus.
zh: 你错过公共汽车真是太粗心了。

en: Don't miss the bus.
zh: 别错过公共汽车。

en: You'd better get going in case you miss the bus.
zh: 你最好赶快走，免得错过公共汽车。

en: You'd better leave at once so that you don't miss the bus.
zh: 你最好立刻离开，免得错过公共汽车。

en: I missed the bus.
zh: 我错过了公共汽车。

en: Let's get on the bus.
zh: 我们上车吧。

en: Take a bus.
zh: 坐公共汽车。

en: Should I take the bus?
zh: 我应该坐公共汽车吗？

en: It was careless of her to leave her umbrella in the bus.
zh: 她把伞落在公共汽车上真是太粗心了。

en: I may have left my umbrella in the bus.
zh: 我可能把伞落在公交车上了。

en: There being no vacant seats on the bus, I was kept standing all the way to the station.
zh: 因为公交车上没有空位，我一路站到了车站。

en: Let's hurry so that we can catch the bus.
zh: 我们快点，这样才能赶上公交车。

en: There being no vacant seat in the bus, I kept on standing.
zh: 因为公交车上没有空位，我一直站着。

en: The bus takes fifty people.
zh: 这辆公交车能载五十人。

en: I left my briefcase in the bus.
zh: 我把公文包落在公交车上了。

en: It is cheaper to go by bus.
zh: 坐公交车更便宜。

en: Will you go to Tokyo by bus?
zh: 你坐公交车去东京吗？

en: Some people went by bus, and others by train.
zh: 有些人坐公交车去，有些人坐火车去。

en: Let's take a bus.
zh: 我们坐公交车吧。

en: If you go by bus, you can get there in about one-third of the time.
zh: 如果你坐公交车去，大约能用三分之一的时间到达。

en: Sometimes I go by bus and sometimes by car.
zh: 有时候我坐公交车，有时候我开车。

en: Do you go by bus, by train, or by subway?
zh: 你坐公交车、火车还是地铁？

en: I prefer going on foot to going by bus.
zh: 我宁愿走路也不愿坐公交车。

en: Are you going by bus or car?
zh: 你坐公交车还是开车去？

en: I bumped into an old friend on the bus.
zh: 我在公交车上碰到了一个老朋友。

en: Do you think it will take long by bus?
zh: 你觉得坐公交车要多久？

en: How can I get to the hospital by bus?
zh: 我怎么坐公交车去医院？

en: The bus will take time.
zh: 坐公交车会花时间。

en: Let's go by train instead of by bus.
zh: 我们坐火车去吧，别坐公交车了。

en: How long does it take by bus?
zh: 坐公交车要多久？

en: In the bus, a boy made room for an old woman.
zh: 在公交车上，一个男孩给一位老妇人让座。

en: It takes two hours to go there by bus.
zh: 坐公交车去那里要两个小时。

en: He came by bus.
zh: 他坐公交车来的。

zh: 你能帮我准备派对吗？

en: My brother saw to all the arrangements for the party.
zh: 我哥哥负责派对的所有安排。

en: I'll see to the arrangements for the party.
zh: 我会负责派对的安排。

en: He was still mumbling something about hospitals at the end of the party when he slipped on a piece of ice and broke his left leg.
zh: 派对结束的时候，他还在嘟囔着关于医院的事情，结果踩到一块冰上，摔断了左腿。

en: I will leave everything about the party up to you.
zh: 关于派对的一切我都交给你了。

en: Emma was much in evidence during the party.
zh: 艾玛在派对上非常活跃。

en: Will we be in time for the beginning of the party?
zh: 我们能及时赶到派对开始吗？

en: I've mistakenly deleted the party information and registration you sent to me.
zh: 我不小心删除了你发给我的派对信息和注册信息。

en: I'm very happy to hear about the party.
zh: 我很高兴听到关于派对的消息。

en: Are you coming to the party?
zh: 你要来参加派对吗？

en: Come to the party, will you?
zh: 来参加派对吧，好吗？

en: Whoever wants to come to my party may come.
zh: 谁想来我的派对都可以来。

en: We will welcome whoever wants to come to the party.
zh: 我们欢迎任何想来参加派对的人。

en: It's a hassle trying to decide what to wear to the party.
zh: 要想决定派对上穿什么真是件麻烦事。

en: He took a taxi so as not to be late for the party.
zh: 他为了不迟到派对，就坐了出租车。

en: Have you determined whom you will invite to the party?
zh: 你决定好邀请谁来参加派对了吗？

en: Thank you for inviting me to the party.
zh: 谢谢你邀请我参加派对。

en: Among the guests invited to the party were two foreign ladies.
zh: 在被邀请参加派对的客人中，有两位外国女士。

en: I am grateful to you for inviting me to the party.
zh: 感谢您邀请我参加派对。

en: He was present at the party.
zh: 他参加了聚会。

en: I haven't decided yet whether I will attend the party.
zh: 我还没决定是否参加聚会。

en: I would admire to attend the party.
zh: 我很想参加聚会。

en: I don't know whether to go to the party or not.
zh: 我不知道是否应该去参加聚会。

en: You should polish your shoes before you go to the party.
zh: 去参加聚会之前，你应该擦亮你的鞋子。

en: I would just as soon stay at home as go to the party.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不愿去参加聚会。

en: Though I have decided to go to the party, I'm not looking forward to it.
zh: 虽然我已经决定去参加聚会，但我并不期待。

en: Don't you want to go to the party?
zh: 你不想去参加聚会吗？

en: You invited me to your party, but I can't make it this time.
zh: 你邀请我参加你的聚会，但我这次去不了。

en: Who was invited to the party?
zh: 谁被邀请参加聚会了？

en: I would like to come to your party.
zh: 我想来参加你的聚会。

en: What are you going to wear to the party?
zh: 你打算穿什么去参加聚会？

en: There was food and drink in abundance at the party.
zh: 聚会上有很多食物和饮料。

en: Which present shall I take to the party?
zh: 我应该带什么礼物去参加聚会呢？

en: Only six people were present at the party.
zh: 只有六个人参加了聚会。

en: There were more than fifty girls at the party.
zh: 聚会有五十多个女孩。

en: Over 100 people were present at the party.
zh: 有一百多人参加了聚会。

en: I would like to express to you my deepest gratitude for having been a guest at your party.
zh: 我非常感谢您邀请我参加您的聚会。

en: Can you come to the party?
zh: 你能来参加聚会吗？

en: Don't bring any money to the party; just bring yourself.
zh: 参加聚会不要带钱，人来就行。

en: Everybody at the party was charmed with her grace.
zh: 聚会上每个人都被她的优雅所倾倒。

en: We'll run into her at the party.
zh: 我们会在聚会上碰到她的。

en: I'll see to it that you meet her at the party.
zh: 我会安排你在聚会上见到她。

en: Please say hello to her if you see her at the party.
zh: 如果你在聚会上见到她，请代我向她问好。

en: I met my old friends by the dozens.
zh: 我遇到了很多老朋友。

en: The party puts everyone in high spirits.
zh: 聚会让每个人都兴高采烈。

en: Who will host the party?
zh: 谁将主办这个聚会？

en: I had a lot of fun at the party.
zh: 我在聚会上玩得很开心。

en: At the party there was food in abundance.
zh: 聚会上食物非常丰盛。

en: I hope you had a good time at the party.
zh: 我希望你在聚会上玩得愉快。

en: What was served at the party?
zh: 聚会上供应了什么？

en: Did you meet many interesting people at the party?
zh: 你在聚会上认识了很多有趣的人吗？

en: Everyone had a good time at the party.
zh: 每个人在聚会上都玩得很开心。

en: All the children sat up and behaved themselves at the party.
zh: 所有的孩子在聚会上都坐好并表现得很乖。

en: Her behavior at the party was far from perfect.
zh: 她在聚会上的行为远非完美。

en: I am dissatisfied with his manners at the party.
zh: 我对他在聚会上的举止感到不满。

en: Please say hello to Nancy if you see her at the party.
zh: 如果你在聚会上见到南希，请代我向她问好。

en: A party will be held next Saturday, that is to say, on August 25th.
zh: 下周六将举行一个聚会，也就是说，8月25日。

en: Love to party!
zh: 喜欢参加聚会！

en: I just can't wait for the party.
zh: 我简直等不及参加聚会了。

en: By the time the party is over, dawn will be breaking.
zh: 当聚会结束时，天就要亮了。

en: I'm looking forward to the party.
zh: 我期待着这个聚会。

en: I don't see any point in going if the party is almost over.
zh: 如果聚会快结束了，我觉得去没有任何意义。

en: Hertz and Avis are head to head competitors in the car rental business.
zh: 赫兹和安飞士在汽车租赁业务中是直接竞争对手。

en: Please put some candles on the birthday cake.
zh: 请在生日蛋糕上放一些蜡烛。

en: Blow out all the candles on the birthday cake at once.
zh: 一次吹灭生日蛋糕上的所有蜡烛。

en: Is there a Percy in your class?
zh: 你们班里有叫珀西的人吗？

en: I took advantage of a sale and bought three sweaters.
zh: 我利用打折的机会买了三件毛衣。

en: Let's take advantage of the bargain sale and save money.
zh: 让我们利用降价促销来省钱。

en: Could you tell me how to get to Park Street?
zh: 请问怎么去公园街？

en: If you see the day through with Mr Bark without losing your temper, I'll believe you.
zh: 如果你能和巴克先生一起度过一天而没有发脾气，我就相信你。

en: Mrs. Parker greeted him with a smile.
zh: 帕克太太面带微笑地迎接了他。

en: I need it for the parking meter.
zh: 我需要它来付停车费。

en: Mr Parker tried eating with chopsticks.
zh: 帕克先生尝试用筷子吃饭。

en: The child was hiding behind a big tree.
zh: 那个孩子躲在一棵大树后面。

en: I can't put up with that noise any longer.
zh: 我再也受不了那种噪音了。

en: Take your time, or you may make some mistakes.
zh: 慢慢来，否则你可能会犯一些错误。

en: I wish I could live at a more relaxed pace, instead of having to watch the clock all the time.
zh: 我希望我能以更轻松的节奏生活，而不是一直盯着时钟。

en: She became the first woman to complete a two-way nonstop crossing of the channel in fifteen years.
zh: 她成为十五年来第一位完成海峡双向不停顿穿越的女性。

en: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
zh: 诺曼人在1066年征服了英格兰。

en: Curses, like chickens, come home to roost.
zh: 诅咒就像小鸡一样，最终会回到自己身上。

en: The Normans' conquest of England had a great effect on the English language.
zh: 诺曼人对英格兰的征服对英语产生了很大的影响。

en: The situation has come to the point where we either sink or swim.
zh: 情况已经到了我们要么沉没要么游泳的地步。

en: The Norwegian diplomat mediated the secret negotiations that produced the historic document.
zh: 挪威外交官调解了促成这份历史性文件的秘密谈判。

en: In such countries as Norway and Finland, they have lots of snow in winter.
zh: 在挪威和芬兰等国家，冬天有很多雪。

en: That concert wasn't rocking.
zh: 那场音乐会不够摇滚。

en: Nora looks up to her mother.
zh: 诺拉很尊敬她的母亲。

en: Turn the knob and open the door.
zh: 转动旋钮，打开门。

en: Words of abuse poured from his lips.
zh: 辱骂的话语从他的嘴里倾泻而出。

en: Please come thirsty.
zh: 请口渴前来。

en: An operation on his throat helped him recover from the pneumonia, but it left him without his voice.
zh: 他的喉咙手术帮助他从肺炎中恢复过来，但也让他失去了声音。

en: My throat feels clogged up.
zh: 我觉得喉咙堵住了。

en: I'm thirsty. Can I have a glass of water?
zh: 我渴了。能给我一杯水吗？

en: Since I was thirsty, I drank water.
zh: 因为我渴了，所以我喝了水。

en: My throat feels dry.
zh: 我觉得喉咙发干。

en: My throat burns.
zh: 我嗓子疼。

en: I have a sore throat and a slight fever.
zh: 我嗓子疼，还有点低烧。

en: I'm wheezing.
zh: 我在喘息。

en: I'm dying of thirst.
zh: 我渴死了。

en: I am thirsty. I would like to have a cup of coffee.
zh: 我渴了。我想喝一杯咖啡。

en: My throat feels dry and raw and scratchy.
zh: 我嗓子感觉又干又疼，还很痒。

en: Don't commit yourself.
zh: 不要轻易承诺。

en: You're in perky form, aren't you?
zh: 你今天精神很好啊，是不是？

en: Don't come into my room without knocking.
zh: 没敲门不要进我的房间。

en: He made for the door to answer the knock.
zh: 他走向门口去开门。

en: Don't burst into the room without knocking.
zh: 不要不敲门就闯进房间。

en: I'll call you up later.
zh: 我晚点给你打电话。

en: I'll call you back later.
zh: 我晚点给你回电话。

en: The Nozomi is the fastest of all the trains in Japan.
zh: 希望号是日本所有列车中最快的。

en: Dr. Yukawa, the Nobel prize winner, died in 1981.
zh: 诺贝尔奖获得者汤川博士于1981年去世。

en: It's my dream to win a Nobel Prize.
zh: 我的梦想是赢得诺贝尔奖。

en: Mr Norton is pleasant to work with.
zh: 和诺顿先生一起工作很愉快。

en: Could you let me see your notes?
zh: 能让我看看你的笔记吗？

en: Get out your notebooks and pens.
zh: 拿出你们的笔记本和笔。

en: The notebook came loose.
zh: 笔记本散开了。

en: Mrs. North is very proud of her children.
zh: 诺斯太太为她的孩子们感到非常自豪。

en: Irene Pepperberg, a researcher at Northwestern University, is discovering that a parrot can not only mimic people but also learn the meaning of words.
zh: 西北大学的研究员艾琳·佩珀伯格发现，鹦鹉不仅可以模仿人，还可以学习单词的含义。

en: The mucus is thick.
zh: 黏液很浓稠。

en: I had a slight accident while trekking in Nepal.
zh: 我在尼泊尔徒步旅行时发生了一点小意外。

en: What are you hiding? Come on, tell me. You can't keep it from me. That's creepy.
zh: 你藏了什么？快点，告诉我。你瞒不住我的。这太可怕了。

en: Hey, come on. Don't make a face.
zh: 嘿，别这样嘛，别拉着脸。

en: The net economy is booming.
zh: 网络经济正在蓬勃发展。

en: Is it possible to reproduce 70 copies of your report which appeared in the November issue of The Network and distribute them to our agents?
zh: 能不能把您发表在《网络》十一月刊上的报告复制70份，分发给我们的代理商？

en: Ned held the flag erect.
zh: 内德把旗帜竖了起来。

en: Ned comes from the state of Utah.
zh: 内德来自犹他州。

en: Have you ever heard of Nessie?
zh: 你听说过尼斯湖水怪吗？

en: The mouse ran and the cat ran after him.
zh: 老鼠跑了，猫追了上去。

en: A mouse is a timid creature.
zh: 老鼠是一种胆小的动物。

en: Rats carry the plague.
zh: 老鼠携带鼠疫。

en: Rats breed rapidly.
zh: 老鼠繁殖很快。

en: Rats leave a sinking ship.
zh: 船沉鼠先逃。

en: The rat made a hole in the wall.
zh: 老鼠在墙上打了个洞。

en: It was a mouse.
zh: 那是一只老鼠。

en: A rat ran across the road.
zh: 一只老鼠跑过了马路。

en: A bat is no more a bird than a rat is.
zh: 蝙蝠不是鸟，就像老鼠不是鸟一样。

en: A mouse is running about in the room.
zh: 房间里有只老鼠在跑来跑去。

en: A mouse scurried out of the hole.
zh: 一只老鼠从洞里窜了出来。

en: The mice ate some of the bread.
zh: 老鼠吃了一些面包。

en: Rats have gnawed holes in the door.
zh: 老鼠把门啃出了洞。

en: A rat chewed a hole in the wall.
zh: 老鼠在墙上咬了一个洞。

en: A mouse went for a walk on the table.
zh: 一只老鼠在桌子上散步。

en: The screw, the lever, the wedge, the pulley, etc. are called simple machines.
zh: 螺丝钉、杠杆、楔子、滑轮等等，被称为简单机械。

en: The cat rubs its face against her.
zh: 猫用脸蹭她。

en: Cats usually hate dogs.
zh: 猫通常讨厌狗。

en: The cat didn't move a muscle.
zh: 那只猫一动不动。

en: Cats can see in the dark.
zh: 猫在黑暗中也能看见东西。

en: The cat went through a gap in the fence.
zh: 猫从篱笆的缝隙里钻过去了。

en: Clerks with sticky fingers won't keep their jobs for long.
zh: 手脚不干净的职员干不长。

en: Cats catch mice.
zh: 猫捉老鼠。

en: The cat listened to its steps.
zh: 猫听着它的脚步声。

en: Cats were domesticated by the Egyptians.
zh: 猫是埃及人驯养的。

en: The cat's fur stood on end.
zh: 猫的毛都竖起来了。

en: A cat got out from under the car.
zh: 一只猫从车底下出来了。

en: The cat has just passed by beside me.
zh: 猫刚刚从我旁边经过。

en: Put the cap back on the bottle in case the cat knocks it over.
zh: 把瓶盖盖回去，免得猫把它碰倒。

en: There is a cat.
zh: 这里有一只猫。

en: A cat was sitting on the chair.
zh: 一只猫坐在椅子上。

en: Hold still a moment while I fix your tie.
zh: 别动一下，我帮你把领带弄好。

en: Could you show me that necktie?
zh: 你能把那条领带给我看看吗？

en: Do I need a tie?
zh: 我需要打领带吗？

en: Your tie is crooked.
zh: 你的领带歪了。

en: I left some scallions out on the veranda for too long and they dried out.
zh: 我把一些葱放在阳台上太久了，都干了。

en: Oh please, believe me.
zh: 哦，拜托，相信我。

en: I feel it now.
zh: 我现在感觉到了。

en: I'm looking for a navy blue raincoat, size 36.
zh: 我在找一件海军蓝的雨衣，36码。

en: Hey, you know what?
zh: 嘿，你知道吗？

en: Don't go, dears.
zh: 别走，亲爱的。

en: Honey, will you go shopping for me?
zh: 亲爱的，你能帮我去买东西吗？

en: Will you marry me?
zh: 你愿意嫁给我吗？

en: My, you're looking green around the gills.
zh: 哎呀，你看上去脸色不太好。

en: You know, you made me cry.
zh: 你知道吗，你把我弄哭了。

en: Come on, Bill.
zh: 拜托啦，比尔。

en: May I bother you for a moment?
zh: 我可以打扰你一下吗？

en: Oh, have a heart.
zh: 噢，发发慈悲吧。

en: Let's dance, my darling.
zh: 我们跳舞吧，我的爱人。

en: Wet clothes adhere to the skin.
zh: 湿衣服贴在皮肤上。

en: Wet clothes clung to her body.
zh: 湿衣服紧贴在她身上。

en: My wet clothes clung to my body.
zh: 我的湿衣服紧贴在我的身上。

en: She wiped her wet hair with a towel.
zh: 她用毛巾擦干湿头发。

en: The wet vase left a mark on the table.
zh: 湿花瓶在桌子上留下了一个印记。

en: Bring me a moist towel.
zh: 给我拿条湿毛巾。

en: Water is dripping from the wet towel.
zh: 水从湿毛巾上滴下来。

en: Clean the window with a damp cloth.
zh: 用湿布擦拭窗户。

en: His wet coat was evidence that he had been outside.
zh: 他湿漉漉的外套证明他一直在外面。

en: My feet started sticking in the muddy street. I nearly fell down.
zh: 我的脚开始陷在泥泞的街道里。我差点摔倒了。

en: The muddy road has ruined my new shoes.
zh: 泥泞的道路毁了我的新鞋。

en: I lost my balance on the muddy road.
zh: 我在泥泞的路上失去了平衡。

en: If we eat garlic with caution, we will gain benefits.
zh: 如果我们谨慎地食用大蒜，我们会获得益处。

en: Garlic enhances the flavor of meals.
zh: 大蒜可以提升食物的风味。

en: Garlic is used to improve the taste of food.
zh: 大蒜被用来改善食物的味道。

en: Garlic gives off a strong odor.
zh: 大蒜散发出强烈的气味。

en: Carrots and turnips are edible roots.
zh: 胡萝卜和芜菁是可食用的根。

en: Except for carrots, there is nothing he won't eat.
zh: 除了胡萝卜，没有什么他不吃的。

en: Chickens were looking for food.
zh: 鸡在找食物。

en: The chicken laid an egg this morning.
zh: 这只鸡今天早上生了一个蛋。

en: Hastily acquired knowledge was not enough to solve the problem.
zh: 仓促获得的知识不足以解决问题。

en: I was utterly soaked by the downpour.
zh: 我被倾盆大雨淋透了。

en: They say we're going to get some showers.
zh: 他们说我们这儿要下阵雨。

en: We were caught in a shower and got wet to the skin.
zh: 我们被一场阵雨淋湿了，浑身湿透。

en: I was caught in a shower.
zh: 我淋了一场阵雨。

en: I was caught in a shower and was drenched to the skin.
zh: 我淋了一场阵雨，浑身湿透了。

en: The game was called off because it suddenly started raining.
zh: 比赛因为突然下雨而取消了。

en: A shower has laid the dust.
zh: 一场阵雨压住了灰尘。

en: A gust of wind blew a shower of rain directly into my face.
zh: 一阵风把一阵雨直接吹到我脸上。

en: Down came a shower of rain.
zh: 突然下了一阵雨。

en: Suddenly, the rain fell.
zh: 突然，下起了雨。

en: Thank you for your kind assistance while I was in New York.
zh: 感谢您在纽约期间的帮助。

en: New York State is almost as large as Greece.
zh: 纽约州几乎和希腊一样大。

en: International Business Machines Corporation, based in Armonk, New York, is the world's largest computer firm.
zh: 总部位于纽约州阿蒙克的国际商业机器公司是世界上最大的计算机公司。

en: New York City policemen wear dark blue uniforms.
zh: 纽约市的警察穿深蓝色制服。

en: How large is the population of New York City?
zh: 纽约市的人口有多少？

en: How many flights to New York do you offer a week?
zh: 你们每周有多少班飞往纽约的航班？

en: How many flights to New York do you offer a day?
zh: 你们每天有多少班飞往纽约的航班？

en: What time does the train for New York depart?
zh: 去纽约的火车几点出发？

en: I'd like a nonstop flight to New York.
zh: 我想要一张直飞纽约的机票。

en: How far is it to New York?
zh: 到纽约有多远？

en: Let's take a trip to New York.
zh: 我们去纽约旅行吧。

en: Have you ever been to New York?
zh: 你去过纽约吗？

en: I'll look you up when I visit New York.
zh: 我去纽约的时候会拜访你的。

en: I'm dying to go to New York.
zh: 我非常想去纽约。

en: Is there a nonstop flight to New York?
zh: 有直飞纽约的航班吗？

en: I will fly to N.Y., or anywhere else.
zh: 我要飞往纽约，或者其他任何地方。

en: New York is worth visiting.
zh: 纽约值得一游。

en: New York is a big city.
zh: 纽约是个大城市。

en: New York is among the largest cities in the world.
zh: 纽约是世界上最大的城市之一。

en: New York is the busiest city in the world.
zh: 纽约是世界上最繁忙的城市。

en: New York is the biggest city in the world.
zh: 纽约是世界上最大的城市。

en: New York is sometimes referred to as the melting pot of races.
zh: 纽约有时被称为种族的大熔炉。

en: New York is one of the cities that I previously thought that I wanted to visit.
zh: 纽约是我以前想去的城市之一。

en: New York is a huge city.
zh: 纽约是个巨大的城市。

en: New York is accessible by train from Washington.
zh: 从华盛顿可以乘火车到达纽约。

en: We call New York the Big Apple.
zh: 我们称纽约为大苹果。

en: New York is called the Big Apple.
zh: 纽约被称为大苹果。

en: How do you like New York?
zh: 你觉得纽约怎么样？

en: New York is the center of America's stock exchange.
zh: 纽约是美国证券交易所的中心。

en: New York, where my father is staying on business, is a much more dangerous city than Tokyo.
zh: 我父亲出差所在的纽约，比东京危险得多。

en: New York is on the Hudson River.
zh: 纽约位于哈德逊河畔。

en: Can you tell me what the zip code is for New York?
zh: 你能告诉我纽约的邮政编码是多少吗？

en: The streets of New York are very wide.
zh: 纽约的街道非常宽阔。

en: Winter in New York can be very cold.
zh: 纽约的冬天可能非常寒冷。

en: New York weather is hot and humid in the summer.
zh: 纽约的夏天天气炎热潮湿。

en: The population of New York is smaller than that of Tokyo.
zh: 纽约的人口比东京少。

en: New York's Fifth Avenue is comparable to Ginza.
zh: 纽约的第五大道可以与银座相媲美。

en: The glory of New York is its museums.
zh: 纽约的荣耀在于它的博物馆。

en: How's the weather in New York?
zh: 纽约的天气怎么样？

en: I'd like to do shopping on Fifth Avenue in New York.
zh: 我想在纽约第五大道购物。

en: The stock market crash of October 1987 in New York is still vividly remembered.
zh: 人们仍然清楚地记得1987年10月纽约的股市崩盘。

en: If you visit New York, you've just got to come and see our house.
zh: 如果你来纽约，一定要来我们家看看。

en: When I was in New York, I happened to meet my old friend.
zh: 我在纽约的时候，碰巧遇到了我的老朋友。

en: Change trains at Chicago for New York.
zh: 在芝加哥换乘火车去纽约。

en: We rented an apartment when we lived in New York.
zh: 我们住在纽约的时候租了一套公寓。

en: New York bristles with towering buildings.
zh: 纽约到处都是高耸的建筑物。

en: There are many Japanese restaurants in New York.
zh: 纽约有很多日本餐馆。

en: There are many commercial firms in New York.
zh: 纽约有很多商业公司。

en: There are a lot of tall buildings in New York.
zh: 纽约有很多高楼大厦。

en: Compared to New York, Tokyo is a much safer place.
zh: 与纽约相比，东京是一个安全得多的地方。

en: In New York I lost my way.
zh: 我在纽约迷路了。

en: Many would jump at the chance to live in New York.
zh: 很多人会抓住机会住在纽约。

en: His business in New York was a great success.
zh: 他在纽约的生意非常成功。

en: The New York Times reviews her gallery all the time.
zh: 《纽约时报》经常评论她的画廊。

en: How far is it from New York to London?
zh: 从纽约到伦敦有多远？

en: The ship from New York will arrive before long.
zh: 从纽约来的船不久就要到了。

en: It is a four-hour drive from New York to Boston.
zh: 从纽约开车到波士顿需要四个小时。

en: Mr Newman often comes to Japan.
zh: 纽曼先生经常来日本。

en: Direct flights between New York and Tokyo commenced recently.
zh: 纽约和东京之间的直飞航班最近开通了。

en: Newton established the law of gravity.
zh: 牛顿确立了万有引力定律。

en: Newton saw an apple fall off a tree.
zh: 牛顿看到一个苹果从树上掉下来。

en: Writing news stories is his job.
zh: 写新闻报道是他的工作。

en: I was very surprised at the news.
zh: 我对这个消息感到非常惊讶。

en: It occurred to me that I should keep the news to myself.
zh: 我突然想到我应该对这个消息保密。

en: He brought me a piece of information.
zh: 他带给我一条消息。

en: You will have heard the news, I think?
zh: 我想你已经听说这个消息了吧？

en: Here's some news for you.
zh: 这里有些消息要告诉你。

en: We broadcast news on the hour.
zh: 我们每小时广播新闻。

en: The news was all about the collapse of the Soviet Union.
zh: 新闻全是关于苏联解体的。

en: The news quickly spread.
zh: 消息迅速传开了。

en: According to the news report, the ruling coalition has secured 72 seats as of 5 p.m.
zh: 根据新闻报道，截至下午五点，执政联盟已经获得了72个席位。

en: The news says that there was a big earthquake in Greece.
zh: 新闻说希腊发生了大地震。

en: The news leaked out.
zh: 消息泄露了。

en: Newsweek had a big picture of the ex-movie star entering the police station.
zh: 《新闻周刊》刊登了一张前电影明星进入警察局的大照片。

en: The whole population of New Zealand is 3,410,000, and one seventh of it are the Maori people.
zh: 新西兰的总人口是341万，其中七分之一是毛利人。

en: She will be relocated to New Zealand.
zh: 她将被调到新西兰。

en: We stopped over in Los Angeles for two nights on the way to New Zealand.
zh: 在去新西兰的路上，我们在洛杉矶停留了两晚。

en: New Zealand is a country of sheep and cows.
zh: 新西兰是一个盛产绵羊和奶牛的国家。

en: What's New Zealand like? Is it as sparsely populated as Australia?
zh: 新西兰怎么样？它像澳大利亚一样人口稀少吗？

en: I'm from Wellington, the capital of New Zealand.
zh: 我来自惠灵顿，新西兰的首都。

en: The climate of New Zealand is similar to that of Japan.
zh: 新西兰的气候和日本相似。

en: I hear they have a lot of problems with the tunnels in New Zealand.
zh: 我听说他们在新西兰的隧道有很多问题。

en: They speak English in New Zealand.
zh: 他们在新西兰说英语。

en: She grinned her approval.
zh: 她咧嘴一笑表示赞同。

en: Doraemon often smiles.
zh: 哆啦A梦经常微笑。

en: You can save face with a happy smile.
zh: 一个开心的微笑可以让你保住面子。

en: Nickel is a hard, silver-white metal.
zh: 镍是一种坚硬的银白色金属。

en: You despise Nick, don't you?
zh: 你鄙视尼克，不是吗？

en: A nickel is a five-cent coin.
zh: 五分镍币是一种五美分的硬币。

en: Nick complained to me about the high prices in Tokyo.
zh: 尼克向我抱怨东京物价太高了。

en: Nick looks down on anyone who comes from a rural area.
zh: 尼克瞧不起任何来自农村地区的人。

en: Nick didn't pass the exam, did he?
zh: 尼克没通过考试，是吧？

en: Nick doesn't need to come to my office.
zh: 尼克不需要来我的办公室。

en: Nick owes me ten dollars.
zh: 尼克欠我十美元。

en: Nick is by no means satisfied with the reward.
zh: 尼克对这个奖励一点也不满意。

en: Nick can speak Portuguese very well. That's because he's been studying it for 5 years.
zh: 尼克葡萄牙语说得很好。那是因为他已经学了五年了。

en: Nick hurried to catch the bus.
zh: 尼克匆忙去赶公共汽车。

en: I must ask Nick his new address and telephone number when I see him.
zh: 我见到尼克时一定要问问他的新地址和电话号码。

en: When Nicole heard that her favorite singer had died, she burst into tears.
zh: 妮可听到她最喜欢的歌手去世的消息，突然放声大哭。

en: Nicole can speak Japanese very well.
zh: 妮可日语说得很好。

en: Miss Nicholas swam from Dover on the English side to France in 8 hours and 58 minutes, then turned around and returned to England.
zh: 尼古拉斯小姐从英国多佛游到法国，用了8小时58分钟，然后转身返回英国。

en: "How can a man be born when he is old?" Nicodemus asked.
zh: “一个人老了，怎么能出生呢？”尼哥底母问道。

en: Nixon was caught lying because he bugged his own office.
zh: 尼克松因为窃听自己的办公室而被抓到说谎。

en: Richard Nixon dropped from public attention.
zh: 理查德·尼克松从公众视野中消失了。

en: Nixon tried to stonewall through Watergate by ignoring it, but it didn't work.
zh: 尼克松试图通过无视水门事件来阻挠调查，但没有成功。

en: You must be careful when crossing a busy street.
zh: 过马路时一定要小心。

en: I like busy places.
zh: 我喜欢热闹的地方。

en: I can't get rid of my pimples.
zh: 我没法摆脱我的粉刺。

en: Nikita Khrushchev was at the height of his powers.
zh: 尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫正处于权力的顶峰。

en: My brother seems to enjoy himself at college.
zh: 我弟弟似乎很享受他的大学生活。

en: For one reason or another their holiday in France didn't come up to expectations.
zh: 由于某种原因，他们在法国的假期没有达到预期。

en: No sound was to be heard.
zh: 听不到任何声音。

en: He had no difficulty in finding the place.
zh: 他很容易就找到了那个地方。

en: I just said so without thinking much about it. I didn't mean anything serious.
zh: 我只是随便说说，没怎么考虑。我不是认真的。

en: There are pros and cons to anything.
zh: 任何事物都有利弊。

en: What a beautiful sunrise it is!
zh: 多么美丽的日出啊！

en: How beautiful a sunrise is!
zh: 日出多么美丽啊！

en: What a beautiful garden!
zh: 多么美丽的花园啊！

en: How beautiful it is!
zh: 这多么美好啊！

en: How sad a story this is!
zh: 多么悲伤的故事啊！

en: She said, "How confident he looks!"
zh: 她说：“他看起来多么自信啊！”

en: What a mean fellow!
zh: 多么卑鄙的家伙！

en: Not knowing what to answer, I kept silent.
zh: 不知道该怎么回答，我保持沉默。

en: What a big dog that is!
zh: 多么大的狗啊！

en: What a lovely creature!
zh: 多么可爱的生物！

en: What a wonderful invention!
zh: 多么棒的发明！

en: How wonderful this is!
zh: 这多么精彩啊！

en: What a heavy bag!
zh: 多么重的包啊！

en: How considerate of you!
zh: 你真体贴！

en: What a pity it is!

en: Not knowing what to say, I kept silent.
zh: 不知道该说什么，我保持沉默。

en: How it blows!
zh: 风刮得真大！

en: How beautifully she sings!
zh: 她唱得多么美妙啊！

en: What fun!
zh: 真有趣！

en: I have no excuse.
zh: 我没有任何借口。

en: What a gorgeous sunset! Let's hang around for a couple of minutes and watch it.
zh: 多么绚丽的日落！我们待几分钟看看吧。

en: What a wonderful morning! I feel on top of the world.
zh: 多么美好的早晨！我感觉棒极了。

en: What a wonderful machine!
zh: 多么棒的机器！

en: What a splendid dinner!
zh: 多么丰盛的晚餐！

en: I want to see him no matter what.
zh: 无论如何我都想见他。

en: What a nice face she has!
zh: 她长得真好看！

en: We have to avoid the nuclear war by all means.
zh: 我们必须想方设法避免核战争。

en: How kind of you!
zh: 你真好！

en: What a beautiful flower!
zh: 多么漂亮的花啊！

en: If it's at all possible, I'd like you to take part in the next meeting.
zh: 如果有可能的话，我希望你能参加下次会议。

en: I managed to get out of the crowd.
zh: 我设法从人群中脱身了。

en: I managed to get to the station on time.
zh: 我设法准时赶到了车站。

en: What pretty flowers!
zh: 多么漂亮的花啊！

en: Believe it or not, it came in pack of gum.
zh: 信不信由你，它是口香糖里带的。

en: I managed to finish the work.
zh: 我设法完成了工作。

en: He managed to run the machine.
zh: 他设法启动了机器。

en: You must try and come to the party.
zh: 你一定要尽量来参加聚会。

en: You had better apologize to him for that failure in some way or other.
zh: 你最好以某种方式为那次失败向他道歉。

en: I will finish this work somehow.
zh: 我总会完成这项工作的。

en: How delicious your dinner was!
zh: 你的晚餐真好吃！

en: What a piece of folly!
zh: 真是个愚蠢的行为！

en: What an absurd idea!
zh: 多么荒谬的想法！

en: For God's sake, tomorrow's left behind.
zh: 看在上帝的份上，明天已经过去了。

en: What a miser you are!
zh: 你真是个守财奴！

en: What a nice day it is!
zh: 今天天气真好！

en: This scenery is magnificent.
zh: 这景色真壮丽。

en: What a friend you are!
zh: 你真是个好朋友！

en: What a cheerful story!
zh: 多么令人愉快的的故事啊！

en: Why do I have to do that?
zh: 我为什么要那样做？

en: How strange the weather is!
zh: 这天气真奇怪！

en: What pretty eyes you have!
zh: 你的眼睛真漂亮！

en: What a beautiful view!
zh: 多么美丽的景色啊！

en: What a sad movie it was!
zh: 多么悲伤的电影啊！

en: How smart!
zh: 多么聪明啊！

en: What made him change his mind?

en: What a big eater!
zh: 真能吃啊！

en: What a big pumpkin!

en: What a big dog it is!
zh: 多么大的一条狗啊！

en: What a fast horse that is!
zh: 那马跑得真快！

en: What a lovely day!

en: Your house is fantastic.
zh: 你的房子真棒。

en: What a fine view!
zh: 多么好的景色啊！

en: What's the idea of throwing that stone?

en: What a small world!

en: What a small television set! Does it really work?
zh: 多么小的电视机啊！它真的能用吗？

en: What a hot day it is!
zh: 今天真热啊！

en: How hot it is!
zh: 真热啊！

en: What a rude man!
zh: 多么粗鲁的人啊！

en: What a gorgeous coat you're wearing!
zh: 你穿的这件外套真漂亮！

en: What a tall tree it is!
zh: 多么高的一棵树啊！

en: What a stroke of luck!
zh: 真是走运啊！

en: How lucky we are!
zh: 我们真幸运啊！

en: What?
zh: 什么？

en: How foolish!
zh: 真傻！

en: What narrow stairs!
zh: 这楼梯真窄！

en: How persistent you are!
zh: 你真固执！

en: How cold it is!
zh: 真冷啊！

en: What a queer story!
zh: 真是个奇怪的故事！

en: What a pleasant journey we had!
zh: 我们旅途真愉快！

en: How cute!
zh: 真可爱！

en: What a cute baby! Peek-a-boo!
zh: 这宝宝真可爱！ 躲猫猫！

en: Why am I the only one they complain of? They're just making an example out of me and using me as a scapegoat.
zh: 为什么他们只抱怨我？他们只是拿我当例子，把我当替罪羊。

en: How unlucky I am!
zh: 我真倒霉！

en: What an unlucky boy I am!
zh: 我真是个倒霉的孩子！

en: People who are constantly copying others do it because they can't think for themselves.
zh: 那些总是抄袭别人的人这样做是因为他们自己不会思考。

en: You can't have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不可能事事都如你所愿。

en: You can eat whatever you like.
zh: 你想吃什么就吃什么。

en: Please help yourself to whatever you like.
zh: 请随便吃点什么。

en: Go ahead and start with anything you like.
zh: 随便先吃点什么吧。

en: What vile behavior!
zh: 多么卑鄙的行为！

en: What a nice friend you are!
zh: 你真是个好朋友！

en: What a stupid boy he is!
zh: 他真是个笨男孩！

en: What a fearful waste of money!
zh: 多么可怕的浪费钱啊！

en: What a lot of books! Do they belong to the university library?
zh: 好多书啊！是大学图书馆的吗？

en: How stupid he is!
zh: 他真笨！

en: I'm sure you're thinking to yourself, 'Why is this guy making such a big deal of this?' But make no mistake. This is essential.
zh: 我肯定你在想，'这家伙为什么对这件事这么大惊小怪？' 但请不要搞错。这至关重要。

en: Why should you be so sad?
zh: 你为什么要这么伤心呢？

en: What a wonderful night!
zh: 多么美好的夜晚！

en: What are you making all the fuss about?
zh: 你到底在吵什么？

en: What a lovely day it is!
zh: 今天天气真好！

en: What heavenly weather!
zh: 天气真是太好了！

en: What an exciting game!
zh: 这真是一场精彩的比赛！

en: How wonderful!
zh: 太棒了！

en: What a wonderful family.
zh: 多么幸福的家庭啊！

en: What a great concert it was!
zh: 那真是一场很棒的音乐会！

en: What divine weather!
zh: 天气真是太好了！

en: What a darling outfit!
zh: 这身衣服真可爱！

en: Oh, no! My house is on fire!
zh: 哦，不！我家着火了！

en: What a haughty fellow he is!
zh: 他真是个傲慢的家伙！

en: What a beautiful sunset!
zh: 多么美丽的日落啊！

en: What a beautiful bird it is!
zh: 多么漂亮的小鸟啊！

en: What a beautiful town!
zh: 多么美丽的城镇啊！

en: What a beautiful picture!
zh: 多么漂亮的画啊！

en: What lovely puppies they are!
zh: 这些小狗真可爱！

en: This dish is terrific.
zh: 这道菜太棒了。

en: This soup is exquisite.
zh: 这汤太美味了。

en: What a good shot!
zh: 好球！

en: What a nasty man he is!
zh: 他真是个讨厌的家伙！

en: What a big talk.
zh: 真是大话。

en: No matter what the problem is, it's essential to get at the heart of the matter.
zh: 无论问题是什么，抓住问题的核心至关重要。

en: I don't know how, but I just picked it up naturally.
zh: 我也不知道怎么回事，反正我就自然而然地学会了。

en: "Can you smell something burning?" "Oh, I went and burnt the toast."
zh: “你闻到什么烧焦的味道了吗？”“哦，我把吐司烤焦了。”

en: Looks like I might have to burn the midnight oil tonight.
zh: 看来我今晚可能要开夜车了。

en: I've no idea what's happening.
zh: 我完全不知道发生了什么。

en: I feel sort of dizzy and I feel like throwing up.
zh: 我感觉有点晕，想吐。

en: Somehow it's been a rough day.
zh: 不知怎么的，今天过得很糟糕。

en: Love your neighbors.
zh: 爱你的邻居。

en: What do you want to talk to me about?
zh: 你想和我谈什么？

en: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
zh: 你要爱邻如己。

en: Both Nancy and Jane were absent from school.
zh: 南希和简都缺席了学校。

en: Nancy is a capable nurse.
zh: 南希是个能干的护士。

en: Nancy papered her room green.
zh: 南希把她的房间贴上了绿色的壁纸。

en: Nancy has a hold on her husband.
zh: 南希控制着她的丈夫。

en: Nancy put her elbows on her knees.
zh: 南希把胳膊肘放在膝盖上。

en: Nancy invited him to a party.
zh: 南希邀请他参加聚会。

en: Nancy looks a fool but she's really very clever.
zh: 南希看起来像个傻瓜，但她其实很聪明。

en: Nancy is more shy than reserved.
zh: 南希与其说是内向不如说是害羞。

en: Nancy studied hard.
zh: 南希努力学习。

en: Nancy did some shopping on the way.
zh: 南希顺路买了些东西。

en: Nancy is getting off the train.
zh: 南希要下火车了。

en: Nancy greeted me with a nod from across the street.
zh: 南希在街对面朝我点了点头，算是打招呼。

en: Nancy wants a pair of red shoes.
zh: 南希想要一双红色的鞋子。

en: Nancy can't decide anything for herself.
zh: 南希什么事都不能自己决定。

en: Nancy has been on good terms with my sister for more than five years.
zh: 南希和我的姐姐关系很好，已经五年多了。

en: Nancy looks like my sister.
zh: 南希看起来像我的姐姐。

en: Nancy is a hard girl for me to deal with.
zh: 南希是个很难对付的女孩。

en: Nancy was the first girl to come.
zh: 南希是第一个来的女孩。

en: Nancy ran across an old friend of hers yesterday.
zh: 南希昨天偶然遇到了她的一个老朋友。

en: Nancy is having a chat with her friends.
zh: 南希正在和她的朋友们聊天。

en: Does Nancy have to do her homework now?
zh: 南希现在必须要做作业吗？

en: Does Nancy want to have a dog?
zh: 南希想养狗吗？

en: Nancy is afraid of dogs.
zh: 南希害怕狗。

en: Nancy never fails to write to me once a month.
zh: 南希总是每个月都给我写信。

en: Nancy couldn't move the desk herself.
zh: 南希自己搬不动那张桌子。

en: Nancy didn't mind living abroad by herself.
zh: 南希不介意独自在国外生活。

en: Nancy likes music.
zh: 南希喜欢音乐。

en: Nancy enjoys indoor games.
zh: 南希喜欢室内游戏。

en: Nancy set out on a solo journey.
zh: 南希开始了独自旅行。

en: Nancy is from London.
zh: 南希来自伦敦。

en: Nancy was surprised that Bob won the first prize in the contest.
zh: 南希很惊讶鲍勃在比赛中获得了第一名。

en: Nancy is a shade darker than Helen.
zh: 南希比海伦黑一点。

en: Nancy is a shade darker than Helen is.
zh: 南希比海伦黑一点。

en: Nancy has a piano.
zh: 南希有一架钢琴。

en: Nancy went to London as well as Paris.
zh: 南希去了伦敦和巴黎。

en: Nancy is economical with her smiles.
zh: 南希不轻易微笑。

en: Nancy has a very lively and sweet temperament.
zh: 南希性格非常活泼可爱。

en: Nancy looks so tired.
zh: 南希看起来很累。

en: Nancy doesn't play tennis.
zh: 南希不打网球。

en: Nancy had never seen a giant panda before.
zh: 南希以前从未见过大熊猫。

en: Nancy was to show up at the place, but she didn't make it.
zh: 南希本应该出现在那个地方，但她没能来。

en: Nancy told me about the fire.
zh: 南希告诉了我关于火灾的事。

en: Nancy is stressed out.
zh: 南希压力很大。

en: Nancy cannot have read this book.
zh: 南希不可能读过这本书。

en: Nancy knows better than to marry Jack.
zh: 南希不会傻到嫁给杰克。

en: Nancy is the tallest girl in her class.
zh: 南希是班里最高的女孩。

en: Nancy is kind rather than gentle.
zh: 南希与其说是温柔，不如说是善良。

en: Nancy smiled happily.
zh: 南希高兴地笑了。

en: Nancy cannot have told a lie.
zh: 南希不可能撒谎。

en: Nancy comes from what we call the aristocracy.
zh: 南希来自我们所说的贵族阶层。

en: Nancy never fails to arrive on time.
zh: 南希总是准时到达。

en: Nancy is the most beautiful of the four girls.
zh: 南希是这四个女孩中最漂亮的。

en: Nancy seems to lack sincerity.
zh: 南希似乎缺乏诚意。

en: Nancy and Jane had to go home at five-thirty.
zh: 南希和简不得不五点半回家。

en: I hear that Nancy is very pretty.
zh: 我听说南希很漂亮。

en: I know that Nancy likes music.
zh: 我知道南希喜欢音乐。

en: Not knowing that Nancy had left him, I put my foot in my mouth when I asked Paul how she was.
zh: 我不知道南希已经离开了他，所以当我问保罗她怎么样时，我说错了话。

en: It is necessary that Nancy attend the meeting.
zh: 南希必须参加会议。

en: Nancy, here's a letter for you.
zh: 南希，这是给你的信。

en: I'm kind of sick today.
zh: 我今天有点不舒服。

en: Oooh sick! What is that stuff? It's all spongy.
zh: 哇，好恶心！那是什么东西？全是海绵状的。

en: I envy your lifestyle - living day-to-day like that.
zh: 我羡慕你的生活方式——这样一天天地过。

en: That's a nice car you're driving.
zh: 你开的这辆车真不错。

en: It's true that she knows a lot about cooking, but she isn't a good cook.
zh: 她的确懂很多烹饪知识，但她不是一个好厨师。

en: She is no doubt pretty, but she isn't beautiful.
zh: 她无疑是漂亮的，但她不是美丽的。

en: It is true she is young, but she is wise.
zh: 她的确年轻，但她很聪明。

en: It is true that they talk a lot, but they say little.
zh: 他们的确说了很多，但他们说得很少。

en: It is true that he is poor, but he is contented.
zh: 他的确很穷，但他很满足。

en: It is true he is rich, but he is a miser.
zh: 他的确很富有，但他很吝啬。

en: He is poor, to be sure, but he is happy.
zh: 他的确很穷，但他是快乐的。

en: He may be clever, but he is not very helpful.
zh: 他可能很聪明，但不是很乐于助人。

en: He may be clever, but he often makes careless mistakes.
zh: 他可能很聪明，但他经常犯粗心的错误。

en: Indeed he is young, but he is well experienced for his age.
zh: 他的确很年轻，但就他的年龄而言，他经验丰富。

en: It is true he is young, but he has much good sense.
zh: 他的确很年轻，但他很有头脑。

en: It is true that he is young, but he is clever.
zh: 他的确很年轻，但他很聪明。

en: It is true that he is young, but he is wise.
zh: 他的确很年轻，但他很明智。

en: Indeed he is young, but he is prudent.
zh: 他的确很年轻，但他很谨慎。

en: It is true that he is young, but he is very reliable.
zh: 他的确很年轻，但他非常可靠。

en: It is true he has a good fast ball, but he is often wild.
zh: 他的确有一个很好的快速球，但他经常投球不准。

en: It is true that he has a good fast ball, but he is often wild.
zh: 他的确有一个很好的快速球，但他经常投球不准。

en: He was at the meeting, to be sure, but he was asleep.
zh: 他的确参加了会议，但他睡着了。

en: He is a nice person, to be sure, but not very clever.
zh: 他的确是个好人，但不是很聪明。

en: He may still be young, but he really is a reliable person.
zh: 他的确还年轻，但他真的是一个可靠的人。

en: Indeed he is still young, but he is very prudent.
zh: 他的确还年轻，但他非常谨慎。

en: It is true he is a learned man, but he lacks common sense.
zh: 他的确是个博学的人，但他缺乏常识。

en: It is true that Mochida did his best, but he wasn't careful enough.
zh: 的确，持田尽了最大努力，但他不够小心。

en: I may indeed be wrong.
zh: 我的确可能错了。

en: Your plan sounds good, but the bottom line is: will it bring us more business?
zh: 你的计划听起来不错，但最重要的是：它会给我们带来更多的业务吗？

en: It is true that yours is a good idea, but I am afraid it will be hard to put into practice.
zh: 你的想法的确很好，但我恐怕很难付诸实践。

en: It is true the boy is mischievous, but he is kind at heart.
zh: 这个男孩的确很淘气，但他心地善良。

en: It's true that the project is a difficult task, but Mr Hara will be able to bring it off.
zh: 这个项目确实是一项艰巨的任务，但原先生一定能完成它。

en: So this is New York.
zh: 这就是纽约啊。

en: Indeed this car is small, but it is powerful.
zh: 这辆车确实很小，但动力很强劲。

en: Indeed. He is young, but smart for his age.
zh: 的确。他很年轻，但就他的年龄而言，他很聪明。

en: It may, indeed, be a mistake.
zh: 这的确可能是一个错误。
